description: '''Axé''' ({{IPA|pt|aˈʃɛ}}) is a [[popular music|popular]] [[music genre]] that originated in [[Salvador, Bahia|Salvador]], [[Bahia]], [[Brazil]] in the 1980s, fusing different [[Afro-Caribbean music|Afro-Caribbean genres]], such as marcha, [[reggae]], and [[Calypso music|calypso]]. It also includes influences of [[Brazilian music]] such as [[frevo]], [[forró]] and carixada. The word Axé comes from the [[Yoruba language|Yoruba]] term ''[[Aṣẹ|àṣẹ]]'', meaning "soul, light, spirit or good vibrations". Axé is present in the [[Candomblé]] religion, as "the imagined spiritual power and energy bestowed upon practitioners by the pantheon of orixás". It also has ties with the [[Roman Catholic Church]] and the [[Lenten]] season, which represents the roots of [[Bahian Carnival]].
